resources.string: Adhell enabled. You are safe now.
Adhell is not yet supported on your device.
To enable Adhell, you must activate Admin mode for this app. Adhell uses Samsung APIs which require the Device Administrator permission.
Adhell utilizes Samsung\'s Knox Firewall, which requires a free developer license key.
Your device is not connected to the Internet.

Turn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.

A URL can contain wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com
Rule format to define a URL for a specific app:
	packageName|url
Do you really want to uninstall Adhell? This will also re-enable all disabled apps!
Change these only if you know what DNS is for and what benefits or problems editing could cause. Note that Adhell must be enabled.

Turn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.

A URL can contain wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com
Firewall rule format: packageName|ipAddress|port
Rule example to block port 53 in Chrome:
	com.android.chrome|*|53
DNS addresses have been set. Turn Adhell off and on to take effect.
DNS has been restored to defaults. Turn Adhell off and on to take effect.

In addition to Adhell's standard package, you can add links to remote and local hosts lists.
Adhell can block up to %1$d unique URLs.
	Remote: https://adaway.org/hosts.txt
	Internal: file:///mnt/sdcard/hosts.txt
Your device is running an old version of Knox, so this function may be unstable.
Turn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Turn Adhell off and on for changes to take effect.
Do you really want to enable all apps?
This will replace your existing backup file if it exists. Are you sure?
Do you really want to restore database? Your entire setup will be replaced.
